TdescFragTag.name: basic_reserve_object
TdescFragTag.description: Control which objects are marked as reserved for in use and how. When setting this value, consider these rules: * Sims may never be marked as in use. Do not try to reserve TargetSim, nor you should try to reserve Object if the interaction may run on Sims. * You may not use a 'basic' reservation if you wish to reserve an entire object and that object has parts. In that case, you must use an 'all' reservation. e.g. Sit Sims sit down, and may do so on individual parts of the sofa. Because the interaction targets the part specifically, we use a 'basic' reservation to reserve that and only that part. e.g. Possess Ghosts may possess objects and have them shake. Since they might possess the sofa (in its entirety), we want to use the 'all' reserve type to mark the object, as well as each individual part as reserved for use. This would prevent other Sims from sitting down while the object is being possessed. Note: it is valid to use the 'all' reserve type on any object, not just objects with parts!

TunableEnum.name: crafter
TunableEnum.description: Who is to be crafting the recipe. Typically this is set to Actor if this affordance is targetting an object. You can set this to TargetSim if you want to have the appearance of directing a Sim to craft the recipe. Note that in these cases, which object they use to craft is determined by autonomy. See also 'Funds Source' and 'Paying Sim' for additional tuning if this is for the purpose of employee crafting. Note: If the world object needed for crafting is not on the lot this will fail with a warning that it could not find an affordance to run phases for the recipe on.

Tunable.name: set_target_as_current_ico
Tunable.description: After creating the crafting component, if this is checked, the value of current_ico on the crafting_process will be set to the target. This is a way to make an object that we are not creating as an ICO to behave a bit like an ICO. By setting the current_ico to the target it allows the crafting interactions to return the target as the carry target, enabling the non ICO object to be carried to where it needs to be. For an example of when you might want to set this consider the Kave bowl. The Kava Bowl acts as both an ICO and a Final Product that holds individual servings. The only way to carry the Kava Bowl to the correct place to run the interaction is to set the current_ico to the kava bowl despite it not actually being a traditional ICO.
